body:
Don't blame them, the government forced them.

In smaller countries, like Finland and Sweden, they get 2-3 hour school days, no homework, only 10 grades, more electives, and longer breaks (a month for our typical one-week breaks but they still have the full 2.5 month summer). However in the larger countries like England and China, they're even worse than the US. What it comes down to is that schools are more of a political and business game than education, and you're seeing the larger countries being more concerned with competing with each other education-wise than actually educating people. It's awful but it gets the politicians and school corporations money and that's all that matters.

parent.body:
Don't blame them, the government forced them.

In smaller countries, like Finland and Sweden, they get 2-3 hour school days, no homework, only 10 grades, more electives, and longer breaks (a month for our typical one-week breaks but they still have the full 2.5 month summer). However in the larger countries like England and China, they're even worse than the US. What it comes down to is that schools are more of a political and business game than education, and you're seeing the larger countries being more concerned with competing with each other education-wise than actually educating people. It's awful but it gets the politicians and school corporations money and that's all that matters.

body:
It is now, but it wasn't in the past. My father and grandfather are better educated than I was when they graduated. My grandfather didn't even finish high school and said at the time most didn't unless you wanted to become a lawyer or accountant.

Gramps said they were reading sophisticated things like Shakespeare and national newspapers in the 6th and 7th grades, climbing ropes in pys ed, learning math. Dad said he had over 40 students in his classes and if you so much as farted you'd get the strap.

What we've lost is discipline and our strive for excellence. We now focus on the worst and bring the class to that level as a basis. Teachers are fat, lazy socialists who hate working and would rather show an LGBT video because it means there's no papers to grade.
